author: bolt
title: Mechverse:Origin NFT based Game
description: Create a Game where the player owns all the pieces like a tabletop game

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal does identify a problem within the challenge and if solved would provide benefits for adoption of new users or even old users to migrate to an alternative metaverse. Though in the whitepaper given, it is best to list out the type of potential artists and creators under the MechVerse Collaboration NFTs topic, as this is for marketing purposes as well as interaction with existing games that are on the ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1: Whilst it is stated that the received funds will help pay a new team being formed to work on a 4 month schedule to deliver an MPV of MechVerse:Origin, a good suggestion is to provide the key points of how the budget will be allocated to the new team members, the KPI to deliver the project within 4 months, the scalable solutions towards more languages other than English, Spanish and French. As we assume that the ecosystem consists of multiple languages.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal provides several ways to increase the auditability of the project, which is very positive. However, it would be beneficial to have a more detailed roadmap that allows the community to know the level of progress of the project in the townhalls. 

The proposal mentions that they want to reach their goals in a period of 3 to 6 months, it would be helpful to have more details regarding the main milestones of the project.
f6_assessments.reply: Thanks for your review. We have an attatchment in the proposal that contains a detailed roadmap. It is done week by week, month by month and responsability by responsability. This would allow the Fund to track the progress of the project.

f6_assessments.q0: Although the concept of the game is interesting and it has nice potential, there seem to be some information missing. Would like to see in more details how the development of the game is going, what are milestones (what is already achieved what will be achieved). Idea to have subscriptions paid in Cardano and to have NFTs for certain elements of the game is a nice plus.
f6_assessments.q1: As mentioned, game itself has a good potential on paper. Would be nice to see on what information it is based that there will be 1,000 players after first 6months and up to 10,000 players after 12months. There is already a web site for the game which is a good indicator of progress as there are already subscribers to the game.

That is something that is mandatory to have any type of possibility to track the development of project.  It is mentioned that after the game is completed money will be spent for marketing. What would be the date (approximately, Q?/2022) of completing the game?

f6_assessments.q0:
In terms of ideas, it is certain that this proposal will effectively address the challenges posed. Create a game that allows gamers to both play the game and be profitable in the long run.
The proposers of leveraging Cardano Native Tokens to build a game experience where people can use their wallets to participate in the game are called MechVerse. MechVerse:Origin is a base-building strategy game (Like Rimworld, Factorio and Stardew Valley) inspired in space embedded exploration with Functional NFTs.
They have built a community of over 1000 members. Their Market is NFT Collectors, Crypto Enthusiast and NFT Curious between 25 and 35 years old. This category has the monetary freedom and resources to spend money in entertainment.
f6_assessments.q1:
The original team consisted of 3 founders, but for various reasons, they chose to remain anonymous. Maybe they have enough experience and background to manage this project, but it would be nice to have some link with external reference to validate credentials (linkedin, twitter, etc).
It is suggested to provide "The received funds will help pay a new team being formed to work on a 4 month schedule to deliver an MPV of MechVerse" , it would be helpful to know the profiles of the people involved, and also to estimate calculate the number of working hours, allocate a budget for each workload. This makes it easy for everyone to track and evaluate.
The plan and delivery schedule are clear, detailed and the proposed milestones seems very doable to reach the proposed goals.
f6_assessments.q2:
As mentioned earlier, the information provided is incomplete. If the project is to be successfully implemented, I think it is necessary to add: how to spend the budget / verify team information,...
When visiting the website provided, the features of the NFTs in the game really fascinated me. I think anyhow, this is a very good project, the metrics and delivery schedule are provided in detail, allowing the results to be tracked and evaluated.
f6_assessments.reply:
Thanks for your review. We have an attatchment in the proposal that contains a detailed roadmap. It is done week by week, month by month and responsability by responsability. This would allow the Fund to track the progress of the project.

The team has decided to stay anonymus, but is happily willing to answer any technical question than can help you test our ability to execute.
